courses.name: CSE 3901: Project: Web Application Design, Development, and Documentation
courses.description: This was a project course where a group of 4 students worked together in an agile development scenario to produce web applications. I was the project manager for 2 of the 6 projects. The course culminated in a 3-week open-ended project where my team developed a web application that allowed renters to give reviews of landlords/properties. It included a login management system and a database of users and properties.

courses.name: Software I and II:
courses.description:
The Software courses involved creating software from contracts (design-by-contract principles), 
basic algorithms, data representation, and best-practice programming.

courses.name: Fundamentals of Software Engineering I and II
courses.description: These courses focused on algorithm/graph analysis, data structures

courses.name: Systems I and II
courses.description:
The Systems courses were low-level programming courses (C-programming at machine 
level, assembly code) and how computers work at the operating system level.

employment.title: CCDS Decontamination Technician
employment.description:
In-between semesters, I made myself essential over the course of the pandemic. During my 
time with Battelle, I worked with their CCDS operation in Houston. I took on the position of 
Safety Lead for the latter part of my time at Battelle.

employment.title: Classroom Operations Student Assistant
employment.description:
I develop teamwork as our small team of student employees help guarantee club spaces 
around campus are organized and I work with clubs to ensure spaces are used properly.

employment.title: Research Assistant (Website Manager)
employment.company: Ohio State University - Dr. Leonard Brillson
employment.description:
I semi-regularly update Dr. Leonard Brillsonâ€™s (ECE Professor) website which allows me to
get experience working with the CSE server on campus.

employment.title: Undergrad TA for CSE 1222 (C++ Programming course)
employment.description: I taught students basic concepts in C++ programming for CSE professor Dr. Naeem Shareef

employment.title: Software Developer
employment.description: I worked on an engineering team to design a web app for the Funk Music Hall of Fame

employment.title: Software Developer I
employment.description: Develop QGIS and SPIDACalc plugins to aid in the auditing of utility poles around the United States, as well as creating smaller scripts to handle a variety of repetitive tasks throughout the company.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: I have 5+ years of experience working with python. My projects have involved working with a variety of APIs (the Twitter API, Spotify API, etc.) as well as some data collection and analysis.

skills.name: Groovy
skills.description: While I have only worked with Groovy (a language based in Java) in my position at TRC, it remains one of the more integral languages for that position.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Most of my work in pure java was been minimal, but I have worked in the language for over 3 years and it was one of the primary languages during my college experience.

skills.name: C++/C/C#
skills.description: These were all used in my college career, I have 2-3 years of experience in all of them though I am probably most experienced with C++

skills.name: Ruby
skills.description: I have not used Ruby as much as these other languages, but I have done some web development and data collection using Ruby.

skills.name: Matlab
skills.description: I have only used Matlab for 1 or 2 classes in my college career

achievements.name: Eagle Scout
achievements.description: Most of my earliest leadership experience came from my years in the BSA, I received the Eagle Scout badge my Senior year of High School.

achievements.name: FEH Robot Program: 1st Place Design
achievements.description:
This was a 4-person honors project course that lasted one 
semester. It involved designing and programming a robot to navigate an obstacle 
course. My team was awarded 1st Place in Design

activities.name: Epsilon Tau Pi
activities.description: This fraternity allows me to continue to perform community service around Columbus with other Eagle Scouts at Ohio State University.

activities.name: Open Source Club
activities.description:
As president of this club, I have gained management experience 
while speaking with members of the Columbus tech community. I have also earned 
public speaking experience through my Open Source presentations

activities.name: Hack OH/IO
activities.description:
Worked with a team of 4 (first-year) and a team of 2 (second
year) to design a project over the course of 24 hours. The first year we designed an 
Android app for runners, the second year we created a raspberry-pi powered RC car.

activities.name: Make OH/IO
activities.description:
Worked with a team of 3 people to build an Arduino
controlled device over the course of 24 hours

activities.name: PyOhio
activities.description:
PyOhio is a yearly conference that takes 
place in Columbus for python programmers, as a member of the organizing committee I 
work with the other members to ensure the conference is a success.

projects.name: GPXtoHeatmap
projects.description: A python script that takes in a GPX file and outputs a heatmap of the points in the GPX file. The heatmap is generated using the Google Maps API.

projects.name: GiphyMaubot
projects.description: A plugin for Maubot (a matrix chat bot) that allows users to search for gifs using the Giphy and Tenor API.

projects.name: PollMaubot
projects.description: A plugin for Maubot (a matrix chat bot) that allows users to create polls in a matrix chatroom.

projects.name: SpotifyTrackComparion
projects.description: A simple Java Swing application that allows you to compare the audio features of 2 songs using hte Spotify API.

projects.name: Grouptivity
projects.description: A 3-person group project for a Mobile App Development course, that makes it easy to find and plan activities with a group
